pros: Residents come first, transparency is prioritized throughout the organization, incredible executive director and DON, awesome emphasis on living out the organization's values

pros: Steady paycheck and benefits hours are available if you want them.

pros: Free lunch yearly Christmas bonus

pros: Great mission of serving older adults.

pros: - Very convenient hours, not too early or too late. - The residents are all very sweet. They care about you as a person and they love to ask about your life. Working with them is a delight.
cons: - Only high schoolers and retirees can afford to work this job. - Pay does not scale based on responsibilities. I knew people who had taken on managerial roles but were refused extra pay. They either left the company or applied to a different role.

pros: Located in a good area
cons: Everything else there to be honest

pros: Focused on employees and assuring they feel supported. I have been with Ohio Living for 13 years. Our team has longevity and great passion for their work. We are focused on caring for each other, as well as our clients. Team members come to work and join our team and stay. We have VERY little turnover, like 2% average. Our company is very employee driven and provides care to our clients despite cost. Patients and employees truly come first with Ohio Living.
cons: Staff that joins the workforce that isn't able to manage the work load, and doesn't have the ability to handle ANY stress , even when they are supported and basically doing 1/2 the work that the strong clinicians can handle.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Columbus, OH
pros: -faith based environment - great patient care - Lots of resources available both to staff and patients - 40 hr 1st year vacation - decent benefits, including paid mileage
cons: - pay is not great - does not offer private duty nursing care -extensive commute time

review_title: Great people! Great Care! Greatly mismanaged at branch levels!
pros: Care models and philosophy of patient care is great. The Nurses, CNAs and other support staff were som of the most caring and committed professionals I have had the privilege of working with.
cons: Salaried employees were grossly taken advantage of and pay scales at the low end of average ranges.

pros: Hospice patients and their families
cons: It was money/profit (even though they’re not-for-profit & claim to be Christian company), over nurses and patients/patient care! Increasing census was the most important focus! Patients spread out over 5 counties & not enough time to see so many patients in one day! Computer programs for charting was geared towards home health/Oasis, and way too detailed for hospice charting (mostly done after hours, at home) patients! Every single nurse quit, even our clinical leader! These opinions don’t just belong to me!

pros: Supportive team and great pay and benefits
cons: How to rotate weekends, that includes Saturday and Sunday which is not very family friendly.

Issues with payroll, vacation time, health benefits.

review_title: Progressive Culinary and Nutritional Service Department
job_title: Corp Director CNS in Columbus, OH
pros:
For 18 years I have enjoyed working with a very progressive and dedicated group of culinary and nutritional services professionals. There is both internal and external resources to grow and develop professional skills. Career growth is met by opportunity and a history of culinary advancement. Many of our chefs have left their jobs at hotels and restaurants to pursue a challenging career in long term care dining with OPRS. Our CNS team has received a great deal of recognition and  many awards in the food service industry for their innovative approach to culinary. 
Many kitchens have efficient designs with some of the latest equipment and technology making for quality outcomes and comfortable work environments. We're always improving.
Give some strong consideration to starting or continuing your career in senior living with OPRS Culinary and Nutritional Services. You will be glad you did.
cons: Nor really a down side. OPRS has done so much to improve the perception of senior living communities and the dining experience. We operate within a  resident centered environment in line with our core values and mission. It's not what some people think of when they imagine senior dining. We're on the level of fine dining.

pros:
Great Environment
Great Pay
Flexibility in Hours
cons: So far, havent found any 'Cons'.

pros: - caring employees and management
cons: - poor pay for job performance

review_title: Management does not care about you
pros: Can be easy at times
cons: Management does not care about you

pros: The company has a strong commitment to provide the best possible experience to the client. The facility in Cortland, Ohio is the nicest nursing home I've ever seen. The staff are friendly and welcoming to new staff members. The company provides little perks, such as free lunch to employees on duty, and bigger perks such as tuition reimbursement.
cons: Management does not communicate well with each other. I would be told one thing by one person, and the next person had no idea. Orientation was far too short, only 6 days. Pay is on the low end, which isn't surprising, as the company is non-profit. I felt, however, that they placed too many demands on my time for the pay, and the benefits package was not strong enough to encourage me to put in extra time.

pros:
This is a wonderful organization who truly cares for their employees. They really work to empower everyone to take pride in their work and be innovative in everything that we do. 
Leadership, especially in the Toledo Home Health and Hospice office is incredible, from mid-level management all the way up auto the executive directors. They allow employees to do their job without micro-managing, and as an employee, I appreciate that. You are held accountable for what you do, but as long as you're getting the work done, they leave you alone to do it. This means that the work that is done in return is more often than not top quality.
cons: If you utilize the health insurance benefit, it is costly. It would also be nice if they would reimburse for mileage at the federal rate instead of at .45/mile. They tell you that you can claim the excess on your taxes, but if you don't qualify for itemization, you can't file to get that back. I've been out that money since I started working here years ago.

job_title: Corporate Manager of Digital Marketing in Columbus, OH
pros: Good people and helps seniors, free lunch occasionally
cons:
While I’m sure other roles are good, the digital marketing role was not. One person is expected to do everything digital (including IT help and password reset/logins) for 20 locations plus corporate, the foundation and HR recruiting. The digital responsibilities of one person for each of these locations include social management, content creation, email marketing, social/digital advertising, design, analytics, website management, internal communications, strategy and (the best one) video production. Eek!

It’s honestly chaos. I had to bring in my MacBook  everyday because the old windows computers they provide are slow/don’t support all the Adobe suite programs. It’s unfortunate because I like the company, but with absolutely no work from home or flex time plus  lack of proper resources, I couldn’t stay for even a year. I do think the brand team members are supremely talented people who just don’t have the resources to accomplish everything put on their plate.

pros: Relatively easy hiring process with a lot of work availability. Staff does really seem to genuinely care for it's patients and it's relatively new and clean. They also have free lunch and dinner served while on shift.
cons: Low starting wages for stna/cna. Almost always short staffed due to high employee turn-over rate. Scheduling vacations and days off can be problematic due to lack of staff and lack of organization. They only schedule certain orientations on Mondays which can be problematic if that doesn't fit your schedule. It's also almost impossible to switch from full-time to part-time to on-call.

job_title: Culinary Services Worker in Willoughby, OH
pros:
very flexible hours, worked well with school, or other plans
Getting to work with, and talk to the residents at the building I worked at was wonderful, many of the stories they told will stay with me for the rest of my life.
cons:
Pay is minimum wage + a Christmas bonus, although the size of the bonus went down each of the years I was with OPRS.
management is often slow to react when informed of issues, both those of the residents and of employees
Yearly performance reviews often do not reflect workers effort or their productivity, scores seem to be random.

pros: Pay for your education. Lots of available avenues for choosing a career and business will pay for your education. Free Lunches or Dinners. Friendly environment. Daycare on site. Pay rate as an STNA.
cons: Needs better benefits, (healthcare, vision ect.) Under staffed. Turnover to fast. lose co-workers fast. Co-workers are promoted to day shift by sonority, NOT by the quality of work and dedication to residents and nurses.

pros: Most of the clinical staff are amazing and love what they do.
cons: Management harass the employees and they micromanage everything.  Many of them talk about not only their employees behind there backs but also each other.  It's all about numbers and hospice to them.

pros: Senior Independence lives by their mission. To be a faith based mission driven organization. I never dreamed to actually work for a company that just feels like family. Senior Independence works very closely with their corporate headquarters, OPRS. OPRS and Senior Independence work hand in hand to not only provide the best care for their clients, but for their employees as well. Many have found a home at Senior Independence like I have! Highly recommend! The culture of this organization is fantastic!
cons: I truthfully am unable to come up with any cons regarding Senior Independence. My experience has been wonderful!

job_title: Sales and Admissions Associate in Willoughby, OH
pros: Definitely the people and ethics of the organization which are faith based. Pure satisfaction in helping elders find the best continuum of health care organization in the country!
cons: Low paying salaries since a non profit which is hard when one has worked for over 30 years in a lucrative corporate environment.

review_title: Faith based, not for profit?  I think not

cons: Only Ohio based. Not a lot of room for relocation. Under staffed at times and some times have to turn down clients because of being under staffed.

pros: I completed an internship for school at Ohio Living and later was hired PRN in the social services department (LSW). The staff at Ohio Living are very accommodating, supportive, friendly and fun. If I hadn't been busy with school and moving to another area, I would have loved to continue working there.
cons: Upper management can be difficult to effectively communicate with at times.
